trans-unit.source: (Hopefully it's clear that apply corresponds to @Hadley's aaply and aggregate corresponds to @Hadley's ddply etc. Slide 20 of the same slideshare will clarify if you don't get it from this image.)
trans-unit.target: （希望很明显， apply 对应于 aaply 的aaply， aggregate 对应于 ddply 的ddply等。如果您没有从这张图片中获得幻灯片，则相同幻灯片共享的幻灯片20将会阐明。）

trans-unit.source: (on the left is input, on the top is output)
trans-unit.target: (左边是输入,上面是输出)

trans-unit.source: Advanced R: Functional Programming, by Hadley Wickham
trans-unit.target: 高级R：函数式编程，作者：Hadley Wickham

trans-unit.source: Simple Functional Programming in R, by Michael Barton
trans-unit.target: R中的简单函数式编程，作者：Michael Barton

trans-unit.source: BY is a S3 generic for split-apply-combine computing with vector, matrix and data.frame method. It is significantly faster than tapply, by and aggregate (an also faster than plyr, on large data dplyr is faster though).
trans-unit.target: BY 是S3泛型，用于通过向量，矩阵和data.frame方法进行拆分应用组合计算。这是显著快于 tapply ， by 和 aggregate （一个也快于 plyr ，大数据 dplyr 更快虽然）。

trans-unit.source: aggregate(matrix, grouping, f): similar to by, but instead of pretty printing the output, aggregate sticks everything into a dataframe.
trans-unit.target: aggregate(matrix, grouping, f) ：类似于 by ，但是aggregate不会将输出漂亮地打印出来，而是将所有内容粘贴到数据框中。

trans-unit.source: aggregate can be seen as another a different way of use tapply if we use it in such a way.
trans-unit.target: aggregate 可以看作是使用另一种不同的方式 tapply 如果我们使用它以这样一种方式。

trans-unit.source: apply(matrix, 1/2, f): input is a matrix. output is a vector, where element i is f(row/col i of the matrix)
trans-unit.target: apply(matrix, 1/2, f) ：输入是一个矩阵。输出是一个向量，其中元素 i 为f（矩阵的行/列i）

trans-unit.source: apply is generic: applies a function to a matrix's rows or columns (or, more generally, to dimensions of an array)
trans-unit.target: apply 是 泛型的：将函数应用于矩阵的行或列（或更一般地说，应用于数组的维）

trans-unit.source: by(dataframe, grouping, f): let g be a grouping. apply f to each column of the group/dataframe. pretty print the grouping and the value of f at each column.
trans-unit.target: by(dataframe, grouping, f) ：令 g 为一个分组。将 f 应用于组/数据框的每一列。在每列漂亮地打印分组和 f 的值。

trans-unit.source: dapply (Data-Apply) applies functions to rows or (default) columns of matrices and data.frames and (default) returns an object of the same type and with the same attributes (unless the result of each computation is atomic and drop = TRUE). The performance is comparable to lapply for data.frame columns, and about 2x faster than apply for matrix rows or columns. Parallelism is available via mclapply (only for MAC).
trans-unit.target: dapply （Data-Apply）将函数应用于矩阵和data.frames的行或（默认）列.frames（默认）返​​回具有相同类型和相同属性的对象（除非每次计算的结果是atomic并且 drop = TRUE ）。性能堪比 lapply 为data.frame列，约2倍的速度比 apply 于矩阵的行或列。可通过 mclapply 使用并行性（仅适用于MAC）。

trans-unit.source: eapply is like lapply except that rather than applying a function to every element in a list, it applies a function to every element in an environment. For example if you want to find a list of user defined functions in the global environment:
trans-unit.target: eapply 就像 lapply 一样，只不过它不是将函数应用于列表中的每个元素，而是将函数应用于环境中的每个元素。例如，如果要在全局环境中查找用户定义函数的列表：

trans-unit.source: lapply(vec, f): same as sapply, but output is a list?
trans-unit.target: lapply(vec, f) ：与 sapply 相同，但是输出是一个列表？

trans-unit.source: lapply is a list apply which acts on a list or vector and returns a list.
trans-unit.target: lapply 是一个列表应用，作用于列表或向量并返回一个列表。

trans-unit.source: outer is a very useful function hidden as a more mundane one. If you read the help for outer its description says:
trans-unit.target: outer 函数是一种非常有用的功能，它被隐藏为更平凡的函数。如果您阅读了 outer 帮助，则其说明会显示：

trans-unit.source: plyr and reshape functions have replaced almost all of these functions in my every day use. But, also from the Intro to Plyr document:
trans-unit.target: plyr 在我的日常使用中，plyr和 reshape 功能已取代了几乎所有这些功能。但是，从Intro到Plyr文件：

trans-unit.source: rapply is a recursive apply for nested lists, i.e. lists within lists
trans-unit.target: rapply 是对嵌套列表（即列表中的列表）的递归应用

trans-unit.source: sapply(vec, f): input is a vector. output is a vector/matrix, where element i is f(vec[i]), giving you a matrix if f has a multi-element output
trans-unit.target: sapply(vec, f) ：输入是向量。输出是一个向量/矩阵，其中元素 i 为 f(vec[i]) ，如果 f 具有多元素输出，则为您提供矩阵

trans-unit.source: sapply is a simplelapply (function defaults to returning a vector or matrix when possible)
trans-unit.target: sapply 是一个简单的 lapply （函数默认为返回向量或矩阵）

trans-unit.source: tapply(vector, grouping, f): output is a matrix/array, where an element in the matrix/array is the value of f at a grouping g of the vector, and g gets pushed to the row/col names
trans-unit.target: tapply(vector, grouping, f) ：输出是一个矩阵/数组，其中矩阵/数组中的元素是向量分组 g 处的 f 值，并且 g 被推到行/列名

trans-unit.source: tapply is a tagged apply where the tags identify the subsets
trans-unit.target: tapply 是带标签的应用，其中标签标识子集

trans-unit.source: vapply is a verified apply (allows the return object type to be prespecified)
trans-unit.target: vapply 是已验证的应用（允许预先指定返回对象类型）

trans-unit.source: Building the Right Background
trans-unit.target: 建立正确的背景

trans-unit.source: Map - A wrapper to mapply with SIMPLIFY = FALSE, so it is guaranteed to return a list.
trans-unit.target: 地图 - 一个包装 mapply 与 SIMPLIFY = FALSE ，所以可以保证它返回一个列表。

trans-unit.source: Mnemonics
trans-unit.target: Mnemonics

trans-unit.source: apply - When you want to apply a function to the rows or columns of a matrix (and higher-dimensional analogues); not generally advisable for data frames as it will coerce to a matrix first.
trans-unit.target: 适用 - 当你想一个函数应用于矩阵的行或列（和高维类似物）; 通常不建议使用数据帧，因为它将首先强制转换为矩阵。

trans-unit.source: eapply
trans-unit.target: eapply

trans-unit.source: lapply - When you want to apply a function to each element of a list in turn and get a list back.
trans-unit.target: lapply - 当你想一个函数应用于又将列表中的每个元素，并得到一个列表。

trans-unit.source: mapply - For when you have several data structures (e.g. vectors, lists) and you want to apply a function to the 1st elements of each, and then the 2nd elements of each, etc., coercing the result to a vector/array as in sapply.
trans-unit.target: mapply - 当你有几个数据结构（例如载体，列表）和要一个函数应用到每个的第一元件，并且然后每个第二元件等，结果强迫到向量/阵列中 sapply 。

trans-unit.source: outer
trans-unit.target: outer

trans-unit.source: rapply - For when you want to apply a function to each element of a nested list structure, recursively.
trans-unit.target: rapply - 当你想给一个函数应用到的每个元素嵌套列表结构，递归。

trans-unit.source: sapply - When you want to apply a function to each element of a list in turn, but you want a vector back, rather than a list.
trans-unit.target: sapply - 当你想一个函数应用于又将列表中的每个元素，但是你想有一个向量回来，而不是一个列表。

trans-unit.source: sweep
trans-unit.target: sweep

trans-unit.source: tapply - For when you want to apply a function to subsets of a vector and the subsets are defined by some other vector, usually a factor.
trans-unit.target: tapply - 当你想给一个函数应用到子集的载体和子集是由一些其它载体，通常是一个因素确定。

trans-unit.source: vapply - When you want to use sapply but perhaps need to squeeze some more speed out of your code.
trans-unit.target: vapply - 当你想使用 sapply 但也许需要挤出一些更多的速度你的代码。

trans-unit.source: A factor (of the same length!) defining groups:
trans-unit.target: 一个因素(同长!)定义组。

trans-unit.source: A vector:
trans-unit.target: 一个向量。

trans-unit.source: AGGREGATE
trans-unit.target: AGGREGATE

trans-unit.source: Add up the values in x within each subgroup defined by y:
trans-unit.target: 将 y 定义的每个子组中 x 中的值相加：

trans-unit.source: As I've said, the power of by arises when we can't use tapply; the following code is one example:
trans-unit.target: 正如我已经说过的，当我们不能使用 tapply 时， by 的力量就会产生。以下代码是一个示例：

trans-unit.source: BY
trans-unit.target: BY

trans-unit.source: Can someone explain how to use which one when?
trans-unit.target: 谁能解释一下哪种情况下如何使用哪种?

trans-unit.source: Conceptually, learning plyr is no more difficult than understanding the base *apply functions.
trans-unit.target: 从概念上讲，学习 plyr 并不比理解基本的 *apply 函数困难。

trans-unit.source: Despite all the great answers here, there are 2 more base functions that deserve to be mentioned, the useful outer function and the obscure eapply function
trans-unit.target: 尽管这里有很多很好的答案，但是还有两个基本功能值得一提，有用的 outer 功能和晦涩的 eapply 功能

trans-unit.source: Despite the fact (noted in other answers) that much of the functionality of the *apply family is covered by the extremely popular plyr package, the base functions remain useful and worth knowing.
trans-unit.target: 尽管* apply家族的许多功能（在其他流行的 plyr 指出）被极为流行的plyr包所涵盖，但基本功能仍然有用且值得了解。

trans-unit.source: Each of these behaviors is of course contingent on our function returning vectors or matrices of the same length or dimension.
trans-unit.target: 当然,每一种行为都取决于我们的函数返回相同长度或维数的向量或矩阵。

trans-unit.source: Examples:
trans-unit.target: Examples:

trans-unit.source: First start with Joran's excellent answer -- doubtful anything can better that.
trans-unit.target: 首先从乔兰（Joran）的出色回答开始 -值得怀疑的事情会更好。

trans-unit.source: For vapply, you basically give R an example of what sort of thing your function will return, which can save some time coercing returned values to fit in a single atomic vector.
trans-unit.target: 对于 vapply ，您基本上为R提供了一个示例，说明您的函数将返回哪种类型的东西，这可以节省一些时间来强制将返回值适合单个原子向量。

trans-unit.source: Frankly I don't use this very much but if you are building a lot of packages or create a lot of environments it may come in handy.
trans-unit.target: 老实说,我不常使用这个,但如果你正在构建很多软件包或创建很多环境,它可能会派上用场。

trans-unit.source: From slide 21 of http://www.slideshare.net/hadley/plyr-one-data-analytic-strategy:
trans-unit.target: 从http://www.slideshare.net/hadley/plyr-one-data-analytic-strategy的幻灯片21中：

trans-unit.source: Grouping functions (tapply, by, aggregate) and the *apply family
trans-unit.target: 分组函数(tapply,by,aggregate)和*apply家族

trans-unit.source: However, I've never quite understood the differences between them -- how {sapply, lapply, etc.} apply the function to the input/grouped input, what the output will look like, or even what the input can be -- so I often just go through them all until I get what I want.
trans-unit.target: 但是，我从来没有完全理解它们之间的区别-{ sapply ， lapply 等}如何将函数应用于输入/分组输入，输出将是什么样，甚至输入是什么-所以我经常只是遍历所有这些，直到得到想要的东西。

trans-unit.source: I have personally used this when I have a vector of values and a vector of conditions and wish to see which values meet which conditions.
trans-unit.target: 我个人曾在有一个值的向量和一个条件向量的时候用过这个,希望看看哪些值符合哪些条件。

trans-unit.source: I have tested two different functions sum and length at once. Volume tested is 50M on input and 50K on output. I have also included two currently popular packages which were not widely used at the time when question was asked, data.table and dplyr. Both are definitely worth to look if you are aiming for good performance.
trans-unit.target: 我同时测试了两个不同的函数 sum 和 length 。测试的音量在输入时为50M，在输出时为50K。我还包括了两个当前很流行的软件包，它们在被问到当时并没有被广泛使用： data.table 和 dplyr 。如果您希望获得良好的性能，那么绝对值得一看。

trans-unit.source: I recently discovered the rather useful sweep function and add it here for the sake of completeness:
trans-unit.target: 我最近发现了相当有用的 sweep 功能，为了完整起见在此处添加了它：

trans-unit.source: If our function returns a 2 dimensional matrix, sapply will do essentially the same thing, treating each returned matrix as a single long vector:
trans-unit.target: 如果我们的函数返回二维矩阵，则 sapply 基本上会做同样的事情，将每个返回的矩阵视为单个长向量：

trans-unit.source: If using the apply family still feels a bit alien to you, then it might be that you're missing a key point of view.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用 apply 家庭仍然对您感到有些陌生，则可能是您缺少关键观点。

trans-unit.source: If we print these two objects, ct and cb, we "essentially" have the same results and the only differences are in how they are shown and the different class attributes, respectively by for cb and array for ct.
trans-unit.target: 如果我们打印这两个对象， ct 和 cb ，我们“基本上”具有相同的结果和唯一的差别是它们的显示方式和不同的 class 属性，分别 by 了 cb 和 array 的 ct 。

trans-unit.source: If you find yourself typing unlist(lapply(...)), stop and consider sapply.
trans-unit.target: 如果您发现自己输入了 unlist(lapply(...)) ，请停止并考虑 sapply 。

trans-unit.source: If you want row/column means or sums for a 2D matrix, be sure to investigate the highly optimized, lightning-quick colMeans, rowMeans, colSums, rowSums.
trans-unit.target: 如果您想要2D矩阵的行/列均值或总和，请务必研究高度优化的，闪电般快速的 colMeans ， rowMeans ， colSums 和 rowSums 。

trans-unit.source: In more advanced uses of sapply it will attempt to coerce the result to a multi-dimensional array, if appropriate. For example, if our function returns vectors of the same length, sapply will use them as columns of a matrix:
trans-unit.target: 如果需要，在 sapply 的更高级用法中，它将尝试将结果强制为多维数组。例如，如果我们的函数返回相同长度的向量，则 sapply 会将它们用作矩阵的列：

trans-unit.source: In the collapse package recently released on CRAN, I have attempted to compress most of the common apply functionality into just 2 functions:
trans-unit.target: 在最近在CRAN上发布的崩溃包中，我尝试将大多数常见的Apply功能压缩为仅两个功能：

trans-unit.source: In the package vignettes I provide benchmarks. Programming with the fast functions is significantly faster than programming with dplyr or data.table, especially on smaller data, but also on large data.
trans-unit.target: 在小插图包中，我提供了基准。使用快速功能进行编程比使用dplyr或data.table进行编程要快得多，尤其是在较小的数据上，在大型数据上也是如此。

trans-unit.source: It is maybe worth mentioning ave. ave is tapply's friendly cousin. It returns results in a form that you can plug straight back into your data frame.
trans-unit.target: 这也许是值得一提的 ave 。 ave 是 tapply 的友好表亲。它以可以直接插入数据框的形式返回结果。

trans-unit.source: Let's say you have a matrix and want to standardize it column-wise:
trans-unit.target: 假设您有一个矩阵，并且希望按列对其进行标准化：

trans-unit.source: Lists of grouping variables can also be supplied to g.
trans-unit.target: 分组变量列表也可以提供给 g 。

trans-unit.source: More complex examples can be handled where the subgroups are defined by the unique combinations of a list of several factors. tapply is similar in spirit to the split-apply-combine functions that are common in R (aggregate, by, ave, ddply, etc.) Hence its black sheep status.
trans-unit.target: 可以处理更复杂的示例，其中子组由几个因素列表的唯一组合定义。 tapply 是在本质上与分割应用-结合，在R 2是常用的功能（类似于 aggregate ， by ， ave ， ddply 等）因此，它的黑色羊状态。

trans-unit.source: My current (probably incorrect/incomplete) understanding is...
trans-unit.target: 我目前的理解(可能是不正确不完整)是......

trans-unit.source: NB: for this simple example the same result can of course be achieved more easily by
trans-unit.target: 注:对于这个简单的例子,当然,同样的结果可以通过以下方法更容易实现

trans-unit.source: Note that if the first argument is a data frame, the dispatched function must have a method for that class of objects. For example is we use this code with the mean function we will have this code that has no sense at all:
trans-unit.target: 请注意，如果第一个参数是 data frame ，则分派的函数必须具有用于该类对象的方法。例如，我们将此代码与 mean 函数一起使用，将得到完全没有意义的代码：

trans-unit.source: On the side note, here is how the various plyr functions correspond to the base *apply functions (from the intro to plyr document from the plyr webpage http://had.co.nz/plyr/)
trans-unit.target: 在旁注中，这是各种 plyr 函数如何与基本 *apply 函数相对应（从plyr网站http://had.co.nz/plyr/的介绍到plyr文档）

trans-unit.source: One of the goals of plyr is to provide consistent naming conventions for each of the functions, encoding the input and output data types in the function name. It also provides consistency in output, in that output from dlply() is easily passable to ldply() to produce useful output, etc.
trans-unit.target: plyr 的目标之一是为每个函数提供一致的命名约定，并在函数名称中编码输入和输出数据类型。它还提供了输出的一致性，因为 dlply() 的输出很容易传递给 ldply() 以产生有用的输出，等等。

trans-unit.source: Other times the results are the same and the differences are just in the class (and then how it is shown/printed and not only -- example, how to subset it) object:

R has many *apply functions which are ably described in the help files (e.g. ?apply). There are enough of them, though, that beginning useRs may have difficulty deciding which one is appropriate for their situation or even remembering them all. They may have a general sense that "I should be using an *apply function here", but it can be tough to keep them all straight at first.
trans-unit.target: R具有许多* apply函数，这些函数在帮助文件中进行了详细介绍（例如 ?apply ）。但是，尽管它们足够多，但是开始使用R可能很难决定哪个适合他们的情况，甚至难以记住它们。他们可能有一个普遍的感觉，即“我应该在这里使用* apply函数”，但是一开始很难保持所有内容的直接。

trans-unit.source: R says that arguments must have the same lengths, say "we want to calculate the summary of all variable in iris along the factor Species": but R just can't do that because it does not know how to handle.
trans-unit.target: R说参数必须具有相同的长度，例如“我们要计算沿 Species 因子的 iris 中所有变量的 summary ”：但是R不能这样做，因为它不知道如何处理。

trans-unit.source: Related functions tapply and sweep have no corresponding function in plyr, and remain useful. merge is useful for combining summaries with the original data.
trans-unit.target: 相关职能 tapply 和 sweep 在没有相应的功能 plyr ，并保持有效。 merge 对于将摘要与原始数据进行合并很有用。

trans-unit.source: Side question: I still haven't learned plyr or reshape -- would plyr or reshape replace all of these entirely?
trans-unit.target: 侧问题：我还没有学会plyr或重塑-将 plyr 或 reshape 取代所有这些完全？

trans-unit.source: Since I realized that (the very excellent) answers of this post lack of by and aggregate explanations. Here is my contribution.
trans-unit.target: 因为我意识到这篇文章的（非常出色的）答案缺乏 by 和 aggregate 解释。这是我的贡献。

trans-unit.source: Syntax:
trans-unit.target: Syntax:

trans-unit.source: Talking about performance: A main goal of collapse is to foster high-performance programming in R and to move beyond split-apply-combine alltogether. For this purpose the package has a full set of C++ based fast generic functions: fmean, fmedian, fmode, fsum, fprod, fsd, fvar, fmin, fmax, ffirst, flast, fNobs, fNdistinct, fscale, fbetween, fwithin, fHDbetween, fHDwithin, flag, fdiff and fgrowth. They perform grouped computations in a single pass through the data (i.e. no splitting and recombining).
trans-unit.target: 谈论性能：崩溃的主要目标是在R中促进高性能编程，并超越所有组合应用组合。为此目的，该包装具有全套的基于C ++的快速通用功能： fmean ， fmedian ， fmode ， fsum ， fprod ， fsd ， fvar ， fmin ， fmax 的， ffirst ， flast ， fNobs ， fNdistinct ， fscale ， fbetween ， fwithin ， fHDbetween ， fHDwithin ， flag ， fdiff 和 fgrowth 。他们通过数据一次执行分组计算（即不拆分和重组）。

trans-unit.source: The by function, as stated in the documentation can be though, as a "wrapper" for tapply. The power of by arises when we want to compute a task that tapply can't handle. One example is this code:
trans-unit.target: 在 by 功能，如文档中表示可以但是，作为一个“包装”为 tapply 。当我们要计算 tapply 无法处理的任务时， by 的力量就会产生。此代码是一个示例：

trans-unit.source: The basic idea is to sweep through an array row- or column-wise and return a modified array. An example will make this clear (source: datacamp):
trans-unit.target: 其基本思想是向扫通过阵列行或列明智并返回一个修改后的数组。一个例子将使这一点变得清楚（来源：datacamp）：

trans-unit.source: The black sheep of the *apply family, of sorts. The help file's use of the phrase "ragged array" can be a bit confusing, but it is actually quite simple.
trans-unit.target: * apply家族的败类。帮助文件中短语“参差不齐的数组”的使用可能会有些混乱，但是实际上非常简单。

trans-unit.source: The power of aggregate is that it can handle easily subsets of the data with subset argument and that it has methods for ts objects and formula as well.
trans-unit.target: aggregate 的强大之处在于它可以使用 subset 参数轻松处理数据的子集，并且还具有用于 ts 对象和 formula 方法。

trans-unit.source: The previous code achieve the same goal and results, at some points what tool to use is just a matter of personal tastes and needs; the previous two objects have very different needs in terms of subsetting.

The two immediate differences are that the second argument of aggregatemust be a list while tapplycan (not mandatory) be a list and that the output of aggregate is a data frame while the one of tapply is an array.
trans-unit.target: 两个直接的区别是， aggregate 的第二个参数必须是一个列表，而 tapply 可以（不是必须的）是一个列表，并且 aggregate 的输出是一个数据帧，而 tapply 的是一个 array 。

trans-unit.source: Then the following mnemonics may help to remember the distinctions between each. Whilst some are obvious, others may be less so --- for these you'll find justification in Joran's discussions.
trans-unit.target: 那么,以下这些符号可能会帮助你记住每个符号之间的区别。虽然有些是显而易见的,但有些可能不那么明显----你可以在Joran的讨论中找到理由。

trans-unit.source: There are lots of great answers which discuss differences in the use cases for each function. None of the answer discuss the differences in performance. That is reasonable cause various functions expects various input and produces various output, yet most of them have a general common objective to evaluate by series/groups. My answer is going to focus on performance. Due to above the input creation from the vectors is included in the timing, also the apply function is not measured.
trans-unit.target: 有很多很棒的答案讨论了每种功能的用例之间的差异。没有答案讨论性能差异。这是合理的，因为各种功能期望各种输入并产生各种输出，但是大多数功能具有按系列/组进行评估的通用目标。我的答案将集中在性能上。由于上述原因，从向量创建的输入包括在时序中，因此未测量 apply 函数。

trans-unit.source: There are other times when we can't use by or tapply and we have to use aggregate.
trans-unit.target: 在其他情况下，我们不能使用 by 或 tapply ，而必须使用 aggregate 。

trans-unit.source: There is nothing in the base package that works like ave for whole data frames (as by is like tapply for data frames). But you can fudge it:
trans-unit.target: 没有什么基本包，像工程 ave 为整个数据帧（如 by 像 tapply 数据帧）。但是您可以捏造它：

trans-unit.source: These elements make aggregate easier to work with that tapply in some situations. Here are some examples (available in documentation):
trans-unit.target: 这些元素使 aggregate 更容易的工作与 tapply 在某些情况下。以下是一些示例（可在文档中找到）：

trans-unit.source: These two articles can help. They provide the necessary background to motivate the functional programming techniques that are being provided by the apply family of functions.
trans-unit.target: 这两篇文章会有所帮助。它们提供了必要的背景来激发由 apply 功能家族提供的功能编程技术。

trans-unit.source: This answer is intended to act as a sort of signpost for new useRs to help direct them to the correct *apply function for their particular problem. Note, this is not intended to simply regurgitate or replace the R documentation! The hope is that this answer helps you to decide which *apply function suits your situation and then it is up to you to research it further. With one exception, performance differences will not be addressed.
trans-unit.target: 此答案旨在充当新用户的路标，以帮助将其定向到针对特定问题的正确* apply函数。注意，这并不是要简单地反省或替换R文档！希望这个答案可以帮助您确定哪个* apply功能适合您的情况，然后由您自己进行进一步的研究。除了一个例外，将不会解决性能差异。

trans-unit.source: This is multivariate in the sense that your function must accept multiple arguments.
trans-unit.target: 这是多变量的意思,即你的函数必须接受多个参数。

trans-unit.source: This is the workhorse of many of the other *apply functions. Peel back their code and you will often find lapply underneath.
trans-unit.target: 这是许多其他* apply函数的主力军。剥离他们的代码，您经常会在下面发现 lapply 的代码。

trans-unit.source: To give you some idea of how uncommon rapply is, I forgot about it when first posting this answer! Obviously, I'm sure many people use it, but YMMV. rapply is best illustrated with a user-defined function to apply:
trans-unit.target: 为了让您了解重新启动的罕见 rapply ，我在首次发布此答案时就忘记了它！显然，我敢肯定会有很多人使用它，但是YMMV。使用用户定义的函数最好地说明了 rapply ：

trans-unit.source: Unless we specify simplify = "array", in which case it will use the individual matrices to build a multi-dimensional array:
trans-unit.target: 除非我们指定 simplify = "array" ，否则在这种情况下它将使用各个矩阵来构建多维数组：

trans-unit.source: Users of Lisp will recognise the paradigm immediately. If you're not familiar with Lisp, once you get your head around FP, you'll have gained a powerful point of view for use in R -- and apply will make a lot more sense.
trans-unit.target: Lisp的用户将立即认识到该范例。如果您不熟悉Lisp，一旦对FP有所了解，您将获得在R中使用的强大观点-并且 apply 会更有意义。

trans-unit.source: We can achieve the same with tapply but the syntax is slightly harder and the output (in some circumstances) less readable:
trans-unit.target: 我们可以用 tapply 实现相同的功能，但是语法稍微难一些，并且输出（在某些情况下）可读性较低：

trans-unit.source: We cannot obtain the previous result with tapply in one call but we have to calculate the mean along Month for each elements and then combine them (also note that we have to call the na.rm = TRUE, because the formula methods of the aggregate function has by default the na.action = na.omit):
trans-unit.target: 我们无法通过一次调用获得 tapply 的先前结果，但是我们必须计算每个元素沿 Month 的平均值，然后将它们组合起来（还要注意，我们必须调用 na.rm = TRUE ，因为 aggregate 函数的 formula 方法默认情况下具有 na.action = na.omit ）：

trans-unit.source: Whenever I want to do something "map"py in R, I usually try to use a function in the apply family.
trans-unit.target: 每当我想在R中做“ map” py时，我通常都会尝试在 apply 系列中使用一个函数。

trans-unit.source: With the by function R dispatch a specific method for data frame class and then let the summary function works even if the length of the first argument (and the type too) are different.
trans-unit.target: 使用 by 函数R调度 data frame 类的特定方法，然后即使第一个参数（以及类型）的长度不同，也使 summary 函数起作用。

trans-unit.source: it works indeed and the result is very surprising. It is an object of class by that along Species (say, for each of them) computes the summary of each variable.
trans-unit.target: 它确实有效，并且结果令人惊讶。 by 沿 Species （例如，针对它们中的每一个）计算每个变量的 summary 是一个类的对象。

trans-unit.source: which makes it seem like this is only useful for linear algebra type things. However, it can be used much like mapply to apply a function to two vectors of inputs. The difference is that mapply will apply the function to the first two elements and then the second two etc, whereas outer will apply the function to every combination of one element from the first vector and one from the second. For example:
trans-unit.target: 这似乎只对线性代数类型的东西有用。但是，它可以像 mapply 一样用于将函数应用于两个输入向量。所不同的是 mapply 将应用于所述函数应用于所述第一两个元素，然后将第二个两等，而 outer 将应用功能从所述第一向量中的一个与第二个元件和每一个组合。例如：
